meanings.definition: Select from a large quantity; pick out.
meanings.sent1: The farmer culls the ripe apples from the tree.
meanings.sent2: She culls the best flowers for the bouquet.
meanings.sent3: The chef culls the burnt cookies from the batch.
meanings.sent4: The teacher culls the incorrect answers from the pile of papers.
meanings.sent5: The detective culls the key evidence from the crime scene.

meanings.definition: Remove something that is considered undesirable or inferior from a group.
meanings.sent1: The zookeeper culls the sick animals to protect the others.
meanings.sent2: He culls the old books from his collection to make space.
meanings.sent3: The gardener culls the weeds to keep the garden beautiful.
meanings.sent4: She culls the damaged fruits from the basket.
meanings.sent5: The editor culls the unnecessary paragraphs from the article.

meanings.definition: To choose or gather the best or most desirable parts.
meanings.sent1: The designer culls the finest fabrics for the new collection.
meanings.sent2: He culls the best players for the team.
meanings.sent3: The artist culls the perfect colors for the painting.
meanings.sent4: She culls the juiciest fruits for the dessert.
meanings.sent5: The director culls the top scenes for the movie trailer.
